project.teaser: SafeNavs ambition is to develop and test a highly innovative digital collision prevention solution that will significantly reduce the probability of collisions, impact damage, grounding, and contribute to safer navigation by a) faster reliable real-time detection of a variety...
project.objective: SafeNavs ambition is to develop and test a highly innovative digital collision prevention solution that will significantly reduce the probability of collisions, impact damage, grounding, and contribute to safer navigation by a) faster reliable real-time detection of a variety of obstacles (other vessels, fixed installations, submerged/semi-submerged objects, and marine mammals) in the marine environment, using data from state-of-the-art sensors and other relevant sources, and b) effective visual representation of the multi-source data to the navigators for quick COLREG-based decision-making support. To this end, SafeNav unites 10 key partners from the maritime industry and academia, including renowned SMEs, R&D institutes and universities to address the Navigational Accidents aspect of the work programme . We will design collision avoidance algorithms built on multi-sensory data input from propriety (LADARTM sensor suite) and off-the-shelf sensors already installed on vessels, extensive statistics of navigational accidents, and other sources (AIS and route exchange services) to create a holistic decision support system (DSS). Processed information from the automatic DSS will feed into SafeNav collision-avoidance algorithms and generate real-time COLREGs-compliant suggestions for the navigator when an obstacle is detected. This reduces pressure on navigators onboard, providing them with efficient decision-making aid and access to visual navigation data on a single graphical user-interface. Sensors will also be used for container tracking, and mathematical models will predict container drift trajectory, transmitting collected data to a SafeNav Navigational Hazard Database available to nearby vessels/stakeholders, facilitating the recovery of lost containers. Moreover, we propose to prevent vessel collisions with cetaceans with optimal-tuned pingers to alert them of an approaching vessels.
project.title: Safe Navigation
project.keywords: navigational accidents, sensor fusion, collision avoidance, object detection, situational awareness, marine mammals, decision support system (DSS), hazard database, AIS, root causes, risk modeling

article.title: Innovative collision prevention system for safe navigation

result.title: Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication Plan (DEP)
result.description: The Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication Plan (DEP) will establish progress made in the first six months of the SafeNav project. Specifically, the team will record the successful creation of the SafeNav Project's webpage and the set-up of the official social media profiles (T10.1), and report on the outcome(s) of the planned dissemination and exploitation activities (T10.2). This deliverable is linked to T10.1 & 10.2

result.title: Data Management Plan (DMP) - Final
result.description: The final DMP will present an outline of the steps to be taken to ensure that the data inflow and outflow of the project is managed while keeping into account all regulatory requirements (such as GDPR) and data agreements, and also that the research outputs are accessible following the FAIR guidelines. Individual data outputs will be identified, and their level of access will be defined.This deliverable is linked with T1.1.

result.title: Development report on COLREG classification module
result.description: A compiled report will be based on COLREG classification module containing different navigational scenarios in order to verify compliance with COLREGs. COLREGs classification module will be focus on own vehicles and targets’ attitude, so course and speed through water will be significant to determine which Rule will be appropriate for each collision situation in this deliverable.This deliverable is linked to T4.2

result.teaser: SafeNav's project emerges against the backdrop of a critical and growing concern within the maritime industry: the alarming rate of navigational accidents, including collisions, groundings, and the subsequent environmental and economic impacts. This initiative is motivated by...

result.title: Report on acoustic pinger studies
result.description: This report includes:•Overview of the use of pinger and statistical analysis•Modelling acoustic propagation of the sound of pinger, the acoustic signature of the ship with and without the pinger•Case-study on the behaviour of marine mammals to the impulsion of pinger•Defining the most efficient and impact less frequencies and the area of efficacyThis deliverable is linked to T6.1

result.description: A compiled report containing user requirements, technical specifications and operational requirements for SafeNav. This deliverable is linked to T2.1 & T2.2

Individual data outputs will be identified, and their level of access will be defined.This deliverable is linked with T1.1.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
